name: Count Prime Numbers Optimized
desc: Implementation of Odd Sieve of Erasthotones optimized to work partitioned that will count how many primes are in the first billion of numbers dense distributed.
kernel: function countPrime(from,to){var memorySize=((to-from+1)/2)|0;var isPrime=[];for(var i=0;i<memorySize;i++){isPrime[i]=1}for(var i=3;i*i<=to;i+=2){if(i>=3*3&&i%3==0)continue;if(i>=5*5&&i%5==0)continue;if(i>=7*7&&i%7==0)continue;if(i>=11*11&&i%11==0)continue;if(i>=13*13&&i%13==0)continue;var minJ=((((from+i-1)/i)|0)*i);if(minJ<i*i){minJ=i*i}if((minJ&1)==0){minJ+=i}for(var j=minJ;j<=to;j+=2*i){var index=((j-from)/2)|0;isPrime[index]=0}}var found=0;for(var i=0;i<memorySize;i++){found+=isPrime[i]}if(from<=2){found++}delete isPrime;return found}var from=params.data[0];var to=params.data[1];var lastNumber=to;var sliceSize=1024*20;var result=0;for(var ifrom=from;ifrom<=lastNumber;ifrom+=sliceSize){var to=ifrom+sliceSize;if(to>lastNumber){to=lastNumber}result+=countPrime(ifrom,to)}
context: The number of primes found is:
